column2: Reporting to the Senior Director of Strategic Sourcing for BTS, this position will work closely with Global Category Managers to help develop and optimize Honeywells global strategic sourcing strategy for the Buy to Sell categories across all business units of Building Automation (BA)     The candidate will utilize total cost of ownership models to manage suppliers and leverage Honeywell s spend across BA    In addition, this person will also support the BTS Sourcing team with key KPI ownership including activities like HGR (Hight growth region) spend growth, spend under contract, supplier rationalization, productivity workshop, spend analytics etc            Job Description     :       Develop category strategies leveraging best-in-class suppliers, processes and products to enable a competitive advantage.              Partner with GBE sourcing partners and cross-functional stakeholders to ensure alignment and support of category strategy creation and execution.            Consolidate fragmented global spend, reduce the use of non-strategic suppliers, and move the procurement activities upstream in the lifecycle of a solution in order to bring greater value to Honeywell.            Execute the annual operating plan through year-over-year improvements in productivity, working capital, quality, delivery and supply continuity.            Identify and select approved suppliers capable of providing solutions that meet established business requirements and follow the global commodity strategies.            Facilitate engagement across all GBEs to drive a singular approach to supplier management in assigned commodity space.            Develop and publish key market intelligence including lead times, capacity, industry trends, benchmarks, etc., to internal partners and stakeholders.            Negotiate and execute supply agreements with strategic suppliers to maximize benefit to Honeywell.            Build strong technical solutions including new technology, VA/VE, CE product and cost improvements with supply base.            Support the refresh of the BTS sourcing AOPs and strategic plans, drive world-class performance from supply base.            Work with GBE sourcing and procurement teams to achieve lowest total cost, continuous quality improvement, and on-time delivery.            Work with global commodity leaders to ensure a coordinated commodity strategy exists across BA around the world. Ensure global policy compliance.            Must Have:            Bachelor s degree.          At least 5 years of work experience in strategic sourcing and leading successful supplier negotiations.          Experience sourcing custom, complex, tooled mechanical/plastic components.

column2: Bulk MRO Industrial Supply Pvt. Ltd. is looking for Procurement Specialist to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    As a Procurement Specialist, your role is to oversee the purchasing process for goods and services required by an organization    You will be responsible for identifying suppliers, negotiating contracts, and ensuring timely delivery of quality products and services    Your primary goal is to optimize procurement activities and contribute to the overall efficiency and cost-effectiveness of the organization     Key Responsibilities:     Supplier Management:Identify, evaluate, and select suppliers based on quality, cost, reliability, and delivery requirements    Develop and maintain strong relationships with suppliers to ensure favorable terms, negotiate contracts, and resolve issues    Monitor supplier performance and conduct periodic evaluations to ensure compliance with contractual agreements and quality standards    Sourcing and Procurement:Conduct market research and analysis to identify potential vendors and assess market trends, pricing, and availability of goods and services    Collaborate with internal stakeholders to define procurement requirements, specifications, and budgets    Prepare and issue requests for proposals (RFPs), requests for quotations (RFQs), and requests for information (RFIs) to solicit competitive bids    Evaluate vendor proposals and negotiate terms and conditions to achieve the best value for the organization    Generate purchase orders, review purchase requisitions, and ensure compliance with organizational policies and procedures    Manage the procurement process from order placement to delivery, ensuring timely and accurate fulfillment of orders    Coordinate with receiving and accounts payable departments to resolve any discrepancies or issues related to purchased items    Contract Management:Develop and maintain contracts with suppliers, including terms and conditions, pricing, delivery schedules, and service level agreements    Review and negotiate contract amendments, extensions, and renewals as necessary    Ensure compliance with contract terms, legal requirements, and ethical standards    Continuous Improvement:Identify opportunities for cost savings, process improvements, and supplier performance enhancements    Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and new technologies in procurement and supply chain management    Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement process improvements and contribute to overall organizational efficiency

column2: Seeking a data-driven professional with 4+ years of experience managing   last mile product life cycles   with the heavy use of tools and algorithms to maximize Wasoko s investments into transport activities by supporting the improvement of the current transport processes and cost.     Duties Responsibilities:       Create and own the product roadmap planning processes for Wasoko last mile operations e.g. Logistics optimization, route planning, delivery process execution, returns management    Formulate and execute a rolling product roadmap in support of portfolio plans. Identify, marshal and organize resources to meet required goals    Lead new product introduction efforts within specific goals for team leadership, customer delivery processes and designs, schedule, cost, quality, availability and order cycle time goals    Engage with internal vendor partners to create, implement and maintain product change management processes within the logistic systems    Align matrices with team members from across all functions to develop new product plans and sustain change management processes. Typical functions include Planning, technical project management, reducing transport cost per order, optimizing the current product, Reporting etc.    Represent delivery product and design team. Use production expertise to influence and negotiate for last-mile operations.    Communicate project status updates to various project stakeholders, including team members and executives. Synthesize a multitude of issues into a clear, concise and focused message. Present with confidence and brevity.    Always push the leading edge of innovation, excellence, and program management practices.    Stay abreast of the latest advancements in technology, competition, industry developments, and regulatory environment.    Help implement best industry standards and best practices in the last leg of supply chain processes and systems      Requirements:       4 - 8 years of experience working with logistics and/or field force for multi-location teams    General manager/owner mentality, entrepreneurial drive, and proven ability to take ownership and influence others    Proven ability to drive cohesion and collaboration among many different people functions    Confidence, presence, and credibility to command the respect of colleagues and senior stakeholders, especially within Sales, Operations and Engineering    Extensive knowledge of product lifecycle management, product strategies, product requirements and roadmap planning, and product requirements decision making    Exceptional communication skills which include clear written and verbal communication as well as the ability to listen effectively    Excellent creative thinking skills with an emphasis on developing innovative solutions to solve complex problems that may not have one clear answer    Demonstrable capability to negotiate requirements and decisions effectively across a diverse range of teams and to lead through influence    Ability to create, formalize, and implement, a product portfolio strategy    Ability to influence cross-culturally across a range of global stakeholders in the engineering, operations, and marketing organizations    Proven ability to execute in all phases of the product development life cycle, resulting in high-quality software or IoT hardware products, delivered on time    Demonstrated ability to work in a self-directed manner, seeking out areas that need attention, rather than being asked to look at specific problem areas    Outstanding technical problem-solving skills and a passion to solve hard problems      Strong program management skill set with the ability to lead cross-functional teams

column2: Sr ISC Analytics Specialist isresponsible for the advanced data engineering and architecture   The Sr ISC Analytics Specialist works as individual contributor, facilitates data engineering, design implementation as well as developing functional& user acceptance, and constructs solutions that remain scalable, adaptable,and replicable to deliver the standard solution across various platforms   Also,to provide technical expertise as a mentor to other team members   This role requires experiencein Big Data and Enterprise Datawarehouse infrastructure,as well adopting appropriate emerging technologies and its solutions to answerbusiness problems and identify opportunities impacting the revenue or operatingincome.    Sr ISC Analytics Specialist isexpected to closely work with ISC Global Analytics team members as well withEnterprise IT team to align practices and priorities to support the transitionof analytics to the FORGE Big Data platform.       Key Tasks and Responsibilities      Connect with business partners and identify opportunities to drive business value via analytics solutions.   Builds intuitive interfaces, infographics, and visualizations to tell stories with data, visualization as a means of business optimization and process transformation.   Design and build publication-ready data pipelines using diverse sets of structured and unstructured data.   Ensure data pipelines are created using credible qualitative and quantitative methodologies based on key insights.   Perform statistical analysis of complex data sets to better understand trends, relationships between variables, and to formulate business intelligence insights.   Pays high attention to data accuracy. In depth understanding of data identification, collection, processing, and analysis methodologies.   Drive continuous improvement and innovation. Work with cross functional teams effectively   Actively consult, conduct pre-development workshops, develop POCs, Lead incubation.   Coach and mentor Data Engineers / Specialists, leading by example through acting as an individual contributor   Work with Honeywell businesses and Enterprise IT teams to clearly outline how enterprise platforms can enable business growth & productivity by seamlessly combining structured and unstructured data into a single, self-service analytical environment.   Leverage knowhow and domain knowledge of Honeywell experts to define, design and develop intelligent solutions to operate on large data sets related to Supply Chain.     Qualifications:      bachelors in engineering / Technology degree or equivalent    Specialized in Computer Science, Software Engineering / Information Technology or related field is preferred   Certifications in Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA) / Azure Data Solution Certification / AWS Solution    Architect Certification / Snowflake certification is desirable   Azure / Databricks / Scala / Python / and Visualization techniques Certification is preferred      Experience:     6+ years of Software development with 4+ years of experience working with data engineering.   2+ years of experience with cloud/on premises data warehouses and data modeling.   2+ years of hands-on experience in creating technical solutions on Cloud - Snowflake EDW / Informatica IICS / HVR as well as design and development on SQL Server is advantageous   Demonstrated experience in progressively challenging and Responsible roles. Must have experience working in Matrix organization structure.   Essential skills:   Experience working with any of the data engineering skills like No SQL, ASW, Kafka, Hadoop et.   Experience working with cloud data warehouses like Redshift, Azure SQL DW, Snowflake, Google Big Query.   Excellent Data crunching and presentation/ interpretation skills- Story building.    Working knowledge of cloud / Big data Platform like Azure or AWS, exposure to Honeywell Forge Big data platform   Must be a good communicator of vision, ideas, and work requirements   Must be an innovative and integrative thinker quick to visualize solutions and generate ideas   Must be able to mentor / coach / guide experienced technology specialists.   Strong business acumen, with ability to draw clear connections between data modeling activities and business challenges/opportunities    Team Player, open to feedback, and flexible & adoptable to changing needs.      Desired skills:     Knowledge in Elasticsearch Kibana, REST APIs.   Experience with the agile and DevOps methodologies   Developing IoT Connectivity Solutions using Azure event hub/Apache Kafka.

column1: SAP Supply Chain & Production Process Architect
column2: To lead the design and implementation of SAP solutions for supply chain, manufacturing, and logistics operations, aligning them with business strategies        Key Responsibilities:          Supply Chain Management (SCM) : Implement and optimize SAP SCM, focusing on procurement, inventory management, and supplier collaboration    Production Planning (PP) : Oversee the SAP PP module for manufacturing process planning, scheduling, and execution    Material Management (MM): Manage the SAP MM module for procurement and inventory management, ensuring efficient material flow    Logistics & Distribution : Utilize SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) and Transportation Management (TM) for optimized warehousing and logistics    Integration with Finance and Controlling ((FICO) : Ensure effective integration of supply chain processes with financial operations in SAP FICO    Process Optimisation & Automation : Continuously improve and automate supply chain and manufacturing processes within the SAP environment    Project Leadership: Direct large-scale SAP implementation projects in supply chain and production areas, coordinating with various stakeholders           Technical Skills & Qualifications:       Bachelors or masters degree in supply chain management, Engineering, IT, or related fields.    Deep expertise in SAP S4 SCM, PP, MM, EWM, and TM modules.    Knowledge of integration with SAP FICO and other relevant modules.    Experience in leading SAP implementation projects in manufacturing and supply chain domains.    Strong analytical, leadership, and communication skills.    At least 7 years of experience in SAP Supply Chain and Production Operations business process design & configuration, preferably in the Industrial sector for End to End processes including:    Manufacturing modules SAP PP,QM,ME,MII & PP/DS    Distribution and Logistical modules SAP MM,WM,TM    Finance FI/CO    Sourcing (integration with SAP Ariba)    Experience in SAP development/configuration, implementation, and integration projects, and have a proven track record of delivering complex and large-scale SAP solutions. Nice to have a certification in one or more of the supply chain SAP modules, such as PP, FI, or SCM.    Strong technical background and knowledge of the supply chain SAP modules and their functionalities, data structures, interfaces, and integration points. Knowledge how to design, develop, and implement the SAP solutions using the appropriate tools, methods, and standards. Ability to read the SAP programming languages such as ABAP, Java, and SQL.    Experience in integration the SAP S/4 HANA with other SAP and non-SAP systems, such as ERP, CRM, BI, and third-party applications. Design, configure, and test the integration scenarios, using the appropriate SAP tools and technologies, such as SAP PI/PO, SAP CPI, CRM, SCM,BI, IoT, SAP API Management.    Good understanding of the business processes and functions of the Industrial company and how they are supported by the supply chain and operations SAP modules. Skills to analyze the business requirements, translate them into technical specifications, and propose the optimal SAP solutions that meet the business needs and objectives. Manage the project scope, budget, timeline, and quality, and ensure the successful delivery of the SAP solutions.    Deep understanding of the SAP S/4 HANA architecture, data model, and business processes.    Proficiency in SAP development tools and languages or at least ability to read the code to support issues resolution, such as ABAP, CDS, BOPF, OData, Fiori, and SAP Cloud Platform.    Experience in designing and configuring custom supply chain and operations solutions, such as reports, interfaces, enhancements, forms, and workflows.    Knowledge of SAP best practices, standards, and guidelines for supply chain and operations development.    Knowledge of SAP security and authorization concepts, such as roles, profiles, and access control.    Experience in testing, debugging, and troubleshooting supply chain and operations issues and performance problems. column2: Maintaining updated error free books of accounts as per accepted accounting principles with complete ownership of the Trial Balance, ensuring Propriety of expense, Receivable management, Statutory compliance, Safeguarding assets of the company, instituting Internal control and Internal check systems, Audits, Document management, Business performance management, Risk Opportunity, Management, Information management and Business Partnering        ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES   Financial Accounting: Books of Accounts Document Management:   - Ensure complete, correct and updated maintenance of books of accounts in accordance with company generally accepted accounting principles.   - Complete ownership of Region trial balance.   - Adequate safe record keeping developing an efficient retrieval system for all documents as on books of accounts, statutory submissions and business performance analysis   Receivable Management   - Implementation of credit management policy monitor credit risk receivable reporting.   - Credit limit and doubtful debt management by customer.   - Setting up system to eliminate teaming lading and balance confirmation.   - Reconciling all debtors at least once a year twice a year for major customer.   - System of update recording of customer claim and settling within 15 days of receiving the claim.   - System of ensuring that no market commitment is unrecorded in books.   - System of ROI driven margin agreement.   - Overdue tracking and DSO management.   - Develop relationship with customer their account team to build trust improved risk visibility.   Management   - System of Creditors reconciliation at least once a year twice a year for major Creditor along with balance confirmation.   - System of update recording of creditors claim and settling within 15 days of receiving the claim.   - System of ensuring that no supplier commitment is unrecorded in books.   Propriety of expense:   - Ensure that expenses recorded in the books of accounts are the expense incurred for the purpose of business in complying internal control policy and procedures of the company.   Safeguarding Assets:   - Ensure adequate insurance cover is taken for all company assets in Region.   - Setting up system of physical asset verification and identifying impairment.   Compliance   - Ensure statutory compliance with Zero noncompliance of relevant statute applicable to business.   - Ensuring on time deposit of tax payable (VAT, Sales Tax, C Form, Shops and Establishment fees etc), correct filing of returns matching with books of accounts, closing tax assessments within a year.   - System of identifying potential tax liability under various statute applicable to factory, its recording and reporting.   - Setting system of collection and safe keeping of EVC, C/F/H/E1 Forms within the statutory time period.   - Setting up system of exception reporting.   Internal Control Audits   - Complete understanding of Internal control policies of the company.   - Educating team ensure adequate internal control is implemented.   - Ensure timely completion of various audits ie statutory, GAAP, tax internal audits.   Business performance management for division   - Business performance analysis and reporting.   - Budgeting, Latest Estimates and strategic plan for their divisions   - Develop financial metrics to measure performance against plan and strategies.   - Proactively provide quality insight of the financial and strategic implication of business actions/strategy to decision maker to enable them to take informed decision.   Pricing   - Product pricing management along with SGA and Supply chain.   - Complete understanding of RTM and taxation impacting product pricing.   - Ownership to keep updated ERP system with any tax change/new tax introduction and its accounting.   - Proactive input to management on pricing strategy to optimize contributive margin and market share.     QUALIFICATION AND SKILL SET   - CA with 3-8 years of experience in manufacturing / sales organization.   - Preferably with Alco Bev or FMCG in industry   - Minimum of two years prior Sales finance experience preferably in distributor environment   - Well versed with Excel and Power point.   - Basic operational knowledge on ERP will be preferred   - Good written and verbal communication skills.   - Good at coordination and multitasking   - Self-starter - Good team player with business acumen and leadership skill

column2: The person hired for the position of Record to Report Product Analyst - SAP FICO will be responsible for the implementation and support of key Finance & Controlling processes in 3M s SAP ERP environment   The successful candidate will possess a strong combination of analytical and technical skills, and will design best practice SAP solutions in close collaboration with business counterparts   The position will include working across multiple process teams on solutions to support both production and new releases of SAP ERP within 3M   In addition, the person will engage in different stages of the deployment activities at 3M, mainly driven by risk and changes to our global footprint   The candidate should have experience with the following configuration areas within the following SAP ERP modules.       CO Reporting and Allocations including:     Consolidated P & L Reporting   Contribution Reporting   Dual Credit   Sales and Gross Margin Reporting     Cost Center Accounting (CO-CCA)     Product Cost Controlling (CO-PC) including:     Product Cost Planning   Cost Object Controlling   Actual Costing/Material Ledger (CO-PC-ACT)   Reporting     Profitability Analysis (CO-PA)   Profit Center Accounting (CO-PCA)   PC&IV Periodic Processes   PC&IV Master Data        The person hired for this position must also understand or is willing to learn the integration of SAP FI & CO with other module/process areas, including Materials Management (MM), Sales & Distribution (SD), Logistics Execution (LE) including Transportation Management and Plant Maintenance (PM)         Primary Responsibilities   include but are not limited to the following:    Assist in implementing/deploying SAP ERP Financials, integration, and testing.   Collaborate with business counterparts in the design, development, testing and delivery of FICO standard and customized solutions in SAP.   Collaborate with IT colleagues, team members and cross functional teams in application design, development, integration, testing and deployment of FICO standard and customized solutions in SAP.   Design, create, test & document the configuration and customizations of SAP Modules to support global business requirements and performance goals.   Work with 3M business areas and IT colleagues to define the overall application and technical requirements.   Ensure the products and components work together to meet the objectives and performance goals as defined in the functional, security, integration, performance, quality and operational requirements.   Production support escalations as necessary.       Basic Qualifications:     Bachelors degree or higher from an accredited university with concentration in Accounting or Management Information Systems.   A minimum of 2 years experience with SAP configuration and design in SAP Finance & Controlling modules.   A minimum of 2 years experience producing business process, configuration, and WRICEF functional design documentation with high quality.   Good understanding of agile methodologies and change management processes.       Preferred Qualifications:     Experience in JIRA, VERA, qTest for change management.   Experience with ITSM for production support and problem management.   Strong verbal and written communication skills.   Educational or professional background SAP Controlling.   A minimum of 1 year experience with international or global SAP deployments.   Good understanding of end-to-end supply chain processes and the interactions between those processes and RTR controlling modules in SAP

column2: Work in a global team as design engineer with significant design responsibilities of electronic circuit design and sensor product development for Aerospace and Transportation application.           The responsibilities include detailed electronic design, verification testing of sensor products and interaction with other teams such as Mechanical design, simulation, drafting, ECAD, Evaluation, manufacturing and marketing.           Responsible for Technical report creation, product failure analysis, documentation & progress reporting.      Perform design analysis results (Stress, Tolerance, Error budgeting, Timing, power etc) and provide technical expertise for design trade off.     Work with operations and supply chain to ensure manufacturability of the product and participate in production test equipment development and design transfer activities.     Maintain high quality documentation of the entire design as required by quality organization.     Perform hands-on work in the lab, as required.       Essential Skills       Minimum two complete product development life cycle experience (initiation, POC, design validation, launch and post release maintenance).           Sound knowledge in Analog, Digital and Power supply circuit design and product development.     Experience in end-to-end qualification testing for compliance and solving EMI issues to meet the required standards. In-depth knowledge of standards such as DO-160, DO-254, AECQ-100           Experience in Analog and Digital Electronic Circuits design, low noise Power Supply design, LDO and DC-DC converters, transfer function modeling, instrumentation & interface circuit design.           Hands-on experience to design circuits with op-amps, transistors, MOSFET, linear and switching regulators and Analog Filter Design.           Knowledge of magnetic sensing ICs for use in a wide range of analog or digitial position sensing applications.           Ability to troubleshoot factory and customer queries.   Good understanding on the customer applications. Able to innovate on next gen products.           Knowledge in DFMEA, Root Cause Analysis, Worst Case Analysis and thermal and derating analysis           Hands on Experience with Digital Oscilloscopes/ Network Analyzers/ Emulators/ Debuggers/ Function Generators, Pulse Generators, etc.           Good knowledge of various serial communication protocols such as SPI, and I2C.           Ability to statistically analyze product data with tools like Excel and Minitab.       Preferred skills             Experience in developing products for Aerospace and Transportation application.           Experience in PCB schematics & layout design tools (ORCAD/Mentor Graphics).           Experience with design for manufacturability, testing and failure mode identification.           Working experience with Sensor signal conditioning circuits           Develop statistical analysis tools in MATLAB or Python.           Familiarity with silicon & IC Fabrication process, MEMS design and application.         YOU MUST HAVE            B.E/ B. Tech/ M.E/ M.Tech in Electrical engineering

She / He shall be responsible for managing procurementoperations of all packaging materials for assigned categories as per plannedrequirements.       II.      Evaluate the requirements of a complex growingbusiness, and adapt procurement processes, plan and execute to meet the same.It involves planning at different horizons (long, medium and short term). Materials might have variabilities of global supply chainsand disruptions. Individual must have ability to plan and should have ongoingmitigation plan to tackle supply risks.       IV. Function as a team player to implement end toend solutions, digital transformation initiatives across the supply chain,including interactions with the demand planning, manufacturing and logisticsteams along with vendors other external agencies. Generation of appropriate MIS and analytics on aregular basis to support performance management systems.       XVI.      Support sustainability initiatives in thebusiness through planning transitions, coming up with suggestions, solutionsand implementations.       XVII.      Drive risk mitigation and cost savinginitiatives as business scale and profitability drivers. column2: Reporting to: Sales Manager  Main Purpose of Role: To support Sales team to achieve the order booking target in terms of top line volume at targeted margin. To offer complete Sales Support by timely submission of Correct Techno-commercial offers. To be able to make compliance statements, submittals, and support sales in their selling process.  To be able to accompany Sales to key meetings with Consultants/Contractors/End Customers on caseto-case basis.  To be able to do / revise the selections of the components as per changes/revisions in the enquiry.  To be able to maintain records of enquiry, quotes etc.  To be able to demonstrate energy savings / comparison between various fans, coils, motors etc and help Sales/consultant/end customer with right choices.  To be able to prioritize work and support sales without delays in submissions.  To be able to interact with vendors/internal-supply chain/other factory/costing functions so that bids can be submitted on time.  To be able to identify key USPs of the product and use them as sales pitch for a given project/client etc.  To be able to independently follow up on the quotes and inform the export sales team on the same.  To evolve with technological changes on a continuous basis so that knowledge matches with the industry trends and specifications. Profile:  Must be minimum a Diploma in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering from an acceptable Engineering college in India or abroad with 0- 5 years exp. in the same field.  A dynamic all-rounder to support our Sales team, with the zeal for converting enquiries to offers, for the complete product range.  Should be a quick learner of Psychometrics, calculations & product Laws.  Since this is a support role Interpersonal skills is essential.  Fluent in English and Should be flexible in meeting deadlines and wiliness to travel if need be on short notices.  Candidates who are willing to learn and work over a long horizon of time only need to apply. This job description is not regarded to be totally exhaustive of all duties and activities required by the post. The post is subject to the needs of the business and will develop and change in line with prevailing market conditions, competition and development of the territory.

column2: We're looking for a Lead Frontend Application Engineer, where your expertise in front-end web app development takes flight in the exciting challenge of empowering flying robots (drones) to perform real, impactful work   you'll contribute to the heartbeat of our AI-focused company by crafting and maintaining web applications that enable customers to seamlessly process visually gathered information, transforming it into actionable tasks and breathing life into our cutting-edge ML and autonomy technology   you'll also dive into the core interfaces utilized by both customers and internal teams to review and refine data collected by our drones, synthesizing it into actionable insights while constructing tools that assess product performance and measure its value for customers, seizing opportunities for growth and learning   you'll have the opportunity to flex your CS fundamentals, seamlessly blending front-end expertise with occasional forays into back-end or full-stack tasks to bring your visionary ideas to life   Join us at Gather and be part of the revolution shaping the future of AI-driven solutions      What you'll Do    Define and implement new features, fixes, and improvements to our web application suite. This includes interfaces that map warehouse physical environments, build flight schedules, control flight progress, and help our customers view immediate data insights and trends based on flight results.   Help us define and refine our overall web systems information architecture - this includes things like sitemaps, user flows, wireframes, and information taxonomy.   Help us build project timelines and stick to them.   Together, with back-end developers, you define data models and APIs that support your scalable, flexible front end applications.   Collaborate with a team of world-class autonomy, machine learning, and full-stack experts on new feature development. Develop and evolve our automated inventory monitoring and data gathering solutions.   Continuously improve the performance, robustness, and scalability of our web applications as we grow, and the footprint and generality of our product as it expands.    Own and eliminate the technical debt that comes with startup growth and learning.   Build and maintain build scripts, tooling, and unit testing fundamental to building a mature, easy-to-evolve, and release CI/CD application platform.   Act as a trusted advisor and mentor to other team members (we are growing)    What you'll Need    BS in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent technical experience.   4+ years of interest and experience developing front end applications.   Comfort with the MERN ecosystem, including React.js, Node.js / Python, Progressive Web Application frameworks (eg React), IndexedDB, Tailwind CSS, and Ant.d.    Experience with transforming user pain points into intuitive and delightful interfaces with or without the help of UI/UX designers.   Interest in designing before developing UI/UX interfaces using Miro/Figma and presenting them to customers and users to seek validation.   Experience working with CI/CD testing tools and releasing production software through the cloud ecosystems.   Extensive experience defining data models and APIs with back-end developers that can support scalable, flexible frontend applications.   Knowledge of and comfort with JS threading, callback, and unit testing best practices.   Good writing skills and a design-for-test ethos.    Customer obsession! We are a customer-obsessed company. If you are not already customer-obsessed, expect to become so!    Nice to Have    Some prior startup growth experience. We are a small but fast-growing company, and we are looking for candidates who are ready to grow their skills with us.   Interest and proficiency in developing rich, possibly event-driven APIs involving multiple concurrent users (and drones!)   GraphQL and gRPC experience - we have rich views on data and are considering these technologies.    Compensation and Benefits    Salary: 30-50 LPA   Flexible schedule   Unlimited paid leave   Remote work home office stipend   Wellness benefits

column2: This position is responsible for taking care of quality control and quality assurance process at WMI supplier place.      Why choose Weir:     Be part of a global organization dedicated to building a better future:   At Weir, the growing world depends on us. It depends on us constantly reinventing, quickly adapting and continually finding better, faster, more sustainable ways to access the resources it needs to thrive. And it depends on each of us doing the best work of our lives. It s a big challenge - but it is exciting.    An opportunity to g   row your own way:   Everything moves fast in the dynamic world of Weir. This creates opportunities for us to take on new challenges, explore new areas, learn, progress and excel. Best of all, there is no set path that our people must take. Instead, everyone is given the support and freedom to tailor-make their own career and do the best work of their lives.    Feel empowered to be yourself and belong  : Weir is a welcoming, inclusive place, where each individual s contribution is recognized and all employees are encouraged to innovate, collaborate and be themselves. We continually focus on people and their wellbeing. We believe in fairness and choose to be honest, transparent and authentic in everything we do.    Key Responsibilities:        Function/ Position Description Requirements    :    Assuring quality parameters of the parts at supplier end as per agreed QAP/ SOP s.   Controlling WPS, WPQ PQR for our parts manufacturing in respective fabrication suppliers   Awareness on welding standards such as AWS D1.1, ASME Section IX, AS 1554, ISO 3834   Awareness of painting standards painting inspection , paint qualification methods.   Support new product launches to ensure suppliers are capable of delivering to the required quality standards   Manage the root cause analysis and corrective actions process of supplier quality issues   Review and evaluate supplier quality data to identify process improvement opportunities within the supply chain   Review supplier manufacturing processes, collaborate with suppliers on process improvement and value enhancement opportunities   Promote the use of customer preferred techniques for continuous improvement such as Lean, Six-Sigma, Poka-Yoke (Error Proofing), Measurement System Analysis and FMEA (Failure Mode and Effects Analysis   Manage the Supplier Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)   Manage customer PPM (Parts per Million), supplier PPM, supplier problem solving on time, cost recovery and supplier warranty indicators   Stay current and up to date on any changes that may affect the supply and demand of needed products and materials and advise others of any impact   Handling Project orders Sand washing plants, Clusters, Skids screen   Ensuring Implementation / validation of quick checking Templates, Jigs and fixture s at supplier end.   Improving the welding quality, aesthetic issues at all supplier end by giving Training.   Documentation of all project orders which includes Dimension inspection reports, Liquid penetrations reports, Painting, blasting and chemlock , MTC etc   Conducting Suppliers process audits as per plan.   New supplier evaluation.   Raising NCR for Non-conformances parts to supplier ensure the effectiveness on closure of NCRs and Audit observations   Fabrication parts inspection at supplier end   Supplier personnel training development   MS office skills (word, Excel power point)   Awareness on Various material standards such as IS 808, IS 13290, IS 2768, IS2062, ASTM 106, ASTM A29, ASTM A 572, ASTM 148, AST A743   Hands on welding inspection, welding defects identification and inspection techniques, instruments devises used in welding inspection       ?

column2: Processes job requisitions and provides support for supply chain, sourcing, cost, price analyses and contract/purchase order generation.     Responsibilities      Working with master planners on outsourcing needs; establishing blanket purchase orders and vendor managed inventory (VMI).    Identifies and leads initiatives to improve the supply-chain process.    Supporting customers and leading customer proposal efforts with pricing information and supplier selection.    Accountable for maintaining supply chain application systems.       Degree Requirement   Degree or equivalent experience desired    Skill Descriptors     Business Process Improvement: Knowledge of business process improvement best practices and ability to use methods for identifying, evaluating, introducing and implementing more efficient approaches to performing business related activities.    Level Extensive Experience:    Analyzes business processes, identifies alternative solutions to outdated processes and assesses their feasibility.    Evaluates financial, cultural, technological and other factors that need to be addressed.    Recommends new approaches that seek the use of advanced technology.    Establishes requirements for large changes in the overall mission, roles, responsibilities and processes necessary to make business improvements.    Participates in defining organizational strategic goals and purposes; defines how to gather and keep customers.    Works to overcome BPI resistance from managers, the labor force and other groups.         Analytical Thinking: Knowledge of techniques and tools that promote effective analysis; ability to determine the root cause of organizational problems and create alternative solutions that resolve these problems.     Level Extensive Experience:    Seeks discrepancies and inconsistencies in available information; explains variances.    Organizes and prioritizes the sequence of steps to be taken to remedy the situation.    Identifies many possible causes for a problem based on prior experience and current research.    Quantifies the costs, benefits, risks and chances for success before recommending a course of action.    Approaches a complex problem by breaking it down into its component parts.    Chooses among a diverse set of analytical tools according to the nature of the situation.         Decision Making and Critical Thinking: Knowledge of the decision-making process and associated tools and techniques; ability to accurately analyze situations and reach productive decisions based on informed judgment.     Level Extensive Experience:    Differentiates assumptions, perspectives, and historical frameworks.    Evaluates past decisions for insights to improve decision-making process.    Assesses and validates decision options and points and predicts their potential impact.    Advises others in analyzing and synthesizing relevant data and assessing alternatives.    Uses effective decision-making approaches such as consultative, command, or consensus.    Ensures that assumptions and received wisdom are objectively analyzed in decisions.    Problem Solving: Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems; ability to apply knowledge of problem solving appropriately to diverse situations.    Level Extensive Experience:    Ensures capture of lessons to be learned from a problem-solving effort.    Organizes potential problem solvers and leads problem resolution efforts.    Uses varying problem-solving approaches and techniques as appropriate.    Contributes to standard practices for problem-solving approaches, tools, and processes.    Analyzes and synthesizes information and devises alternative resolution strategies.    Develops successful resolutions to critical or wide-impact problems.         Project Management: Knowledge of effective project management strategies and tactics; ability to plan, organize, monitor, and control projects, ensuring efficient utilization of technical and administrative resources to achieve project objectives.     Level Extensive Experience:    Utilizes preferred tools, techniques and methods for estimating project cost and time.    Plans, estimates, staffs, organizes and monitors significant projects.    Identifies risks and vulnerabilities; creates contingency plans.    Conducts regular and ad-hoc project reviews with project team, sponsors, and clients.    Maintains open communication among project participants and interested parties.    Communicates reporting requirements; creates monitoring and control mechanisms.         Logistics Management: Knowledge of logistics and management; ability to follow proper processes and run operations for effective and efficient movement of materials and finished products.     Level Working Knowledge:    Assists in the development of process flows to track lead time by activity.    Uses tools, with guidance, to forecast delivery times, determine costs and assess performance.    Maintains records of all shipments and invoices using an established system.    Participates in integrating logistics processes and developing effective networks.    Works with logistics in a domestic environment. column2: As a   Software Support Config Validator  , you are the customer s hero in time of need! A customer s advocate internally and an Esko advocate externally, you stand by our customers when they are in need of upgrades, licenses and other support related requirements, ensuring an effortless software support experience.   If you are looking for an opportunity to help colleagues and customers to grow, with access to some of the most experienced packaging industry experts in your own team, then being part of our Esko software experts could be right up your street. We want you to feel part of a brilliant team and a caring organization that values your ideas and input.      ?         Job Description:        WITHIN YOUR ROLE, YOU WILL:     Be the face and voice of the customer within Esko   The first point of contact when they call for support.   Keep the customer informed and updated as you progress in their requests.   Learn and plug into the latest trends, policies and procedures.   Be part of a customer-centric team of experts, looking after Subject Matter Experts to enterprise customers   React to issues and proactively anticipate customer challenges   Build a trusted partnership with the customer   Help the customer to continuously get the best value they can from the software.   Work on providing them with the required upgrade licenses by thoroughly checking their configuration.   Take the ownership when customers report emergency issues related to licenses. column2: The person hired for the position of Record to Report Analyst - SAP Cash Application and Credit will be responsible for the implementation and support of key cash application and credit processes in 3M s SAP ERP environment   The successful candidate will possess a strong combination of analytical and technical skills, and will design best practice SAP solutions in close collaboration with business counterparts   The position will include working across multiple areas and solutions to support both production and new releases of SAP ERP within 3M   In addition to SAP, the position will support additional applications in the ERP Ecosystem, including but not limited to Serrala         The candidate should have experience with the following configuration areas within the following SAP functionality:       Bank statement processing using standard SAP functionality and EDI.   Document clearing including residual processing.   Document clearing using search strings.   Bill of Exchange.   Financial Supply Chain Management.      The person hired for this position must also understand the integration of SAP FICO with other module/process areas, including SAP FICO, Sales & Distribution (SD) and master data.      Primary Responsibilities     Assist in implementing/deploying SAP Cash Application and Credit functionality.   Execute and deliver SAP Solutions to Cash Application and Credit Operations through the leadership of process design and configuration, which meet defined global business objectives and requirements.   Collaborate with business counterparts in the design, development, testing and delivery of SAP standard Cash Application and Credit SAP Solutions.   Collaborate with IT colleagues, team members and cross functional teams in application design, development, integration, testing and deployment of SAP Solutions.   Design, create, test and document the configuration of SAP Cash Application and Credit functionality to support global business requirements and performance goals.   Work with 3M business areas and IT colleagues to define the overall application and technical requirements.   Ensure the products and components work together to meet the objectives and performance goals as defined in the functional, security, integration, performance, quality and operational requirements.   Identify and help resolve design issues, participates, and provides critique for design reviews.   Advocate recommended process design changes within their process community.   Support adherence to business and program objectives and program mission.       Basic Qualifications:     Bachelors degree or higher from an accredited university with concentration in Accounting or Management Information Systems.   A minimum of 2 years experience with SAP configuration and design in SAP Finance & Controlling, working within the ASAP or a similar SDLC methodology   A minimum of 2 years experience producing business process, configuration, and WRICEF functional design documentation with high quality.   A minimum 3 years experience with MS Office suite.       Preferred Qualifications:     Experience with external interfaces, including EDI, as well as ALE/IDOC definition.   Experience with agile/iterative development methodologies to deliver SAP WRICEF objects.   Strong verbal and written communication skills.   Educational or professional background in Finance or Accounting, including a CPA or CMA designation.   A minimum 1-year experience with international or global SAP deployments.   Strong grasp of integration between SAP Financial Accounting (FI), Sales & Distribution (SD) and master data.   Experience with the following tools: SAP Solution Manager, Jira and Active Control

column2: Our client is a leading European manufacturer specializing in the production of quick couplings for various industries. With a commitment to excellence and innovation, they strive to maintain the highest standards of quality and reliability in our products. To further strengthen its operations team and support the global manufacturing set up in Europe, our client is looking to hire: Supplier Quality Assurance Engineer(based in Bengaluru)Organization: The Supplier Quality Assurance Engineer will play a crucial role in sourcing, validating, and qualifying vendors who provide sub-components to our headquarters in Europe for manufacturing needs. This role involves serving as the primary liaison between headquarters and suppliers in India to ensure quality, timely delivery, and adherence to agreements. Additionally, this role requires overseeing logistics, reporting on orders and inventory, and implementing quality assurance measures.Role & responsibilities Vendor Management: Identify potential vendors/suppliers for sub-components based on quality, cost, and capability requirements. Conduct supplier assessments, audits, and qualifications to ensure compliance with company standards, addressing any issues or discrepancies to ensure timely resolution. Negotiate agreements and contracts with vendors, including quality specifications, delivery schedules, and pricing terms. Conduct visits to vendor sites to inspect components and processes, ensuring adherence to quality standards.Quality Assurance: Handle non-conformance cases with suppliers and implement necessary actions. column2: Designation : District Project Support Officers Job Description District Project Support officers (DPSOS) provide vital assistance to Zonel Head and Project Heads. These highly- organised,  dynamic professionals will work on specific projects assigned by OASYS Group. This project varies from Consultancy/ Support services to Govt agencies,  Privative and Public sector and local authorities. All DPSOs are inextricably responsibilities to the success of the project they are working on. Driving everything forward from planning to implementation,  their actions will directly influence the efficiency and cost- effectiveness of the project. Every project is different and therefore their duties will change accordingly. However,  for the most part,  they will be responsible for monitoring Implementation,  Training,  Governing project schedules and budgets,  preparing progress reports and liaising with key stakeholders. Training Progression The majority of your training will be done on- the- job under the supervision of your Zonel Manager or the Country Head. However,  you may occasionally get the opportunity to take part in in- house training sessions in our State Head Quarters or OASYS Head Office in Chennai. Once you have gained a wealth of project support experience,  you may decide to become a programme support officer,  where youll work on a range of different projects simultaneously. Alternatively,  you might decide to make the step up into project management. Some project support officers choose to work on a freelance basis,  putting their administrative expertise to good use on projects with tight deadlines for a range of different clients. Eligibility Diploma/ Bachelor Degree Fluent in Local / English Language Experience in SHG,  Co- operative bank would be preferable

column2: The Ingersoll Rand Sourcing Team Leader,        you will be responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of the sourcing process, including vendor selection, negotiation, and relationship management. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the timely and cost-effective procurement of goods and services to meet the companys needs.       The role is key to leading the Company forward in securing quality suppliers of materials and components covering price, delivery and quality targets. Develop and implement sourcing strategies to meet the companys procurement objectives and cost-saving targets.                   Identify and evaluate potential vendors and suppliers, assessing their capabilities, pricing, and quality standards.                   Negotiate contracts, terms, and pricing agreements with vendors to ensure favorable terms for the company.                   Monitor market trends and industry developments to identify opportunities for cost savings and process improvements. Establish and maintain strong relationships with key vendors and suppliers, fostering partnerships built on trust and mutual benefit. Results-oriented with a focus on delivering measurable business outcomes and driving continuous improvement. column2: Job Description    Direct, monitor, control and report to General Manager - Materials for all Purchase activities to ensure that they are appropriately performed and employees engaged therein are motivated and trained to carry out their responsibilities to the required standards.     Develop and implement SOPs for departmental activities to ensure that all departmental functions operate smoothly as per the procedure & system.     Ensure that the team complies with organizational policies and procedures at all times through motivation, persuasion and providing clear directions & solutions whenever required.     To lead, guide and motivate a team of engineers and staff reporting to this position.     Procurement of items as per requirement, Production schedule & MD4C.     To ensure smooth functioning of Purchase Dept. in the close co-ordination of Planning, Design, QCA, Production and Service Dept.     Ensure that all components received from suppliers are as per specifications, bear proper identification & traceability, properly packed (with necessary preservatives) and with required documents (e.g. Challan, Invoice, Inspection report)     Forecast price and monitor & analyze market trends (e.g. prices of metal) to identify changes of balance in buyer-supplier power. Maintain rate contracts.     Ensure evaluation & re-evaluation of suppliers (wherever necessary) to ensure that they have defined system in place to deliver components as per our specification & schedule and they continuously upgrade themselves to remain competitive. All suppliers must ensure that all components are 100% checked before delivering it to us.     Maintain approved supplier database.     Ensure that all supplies are as per PO so that there is no difference of MIGO/MIRO. Support in reconciliation of supplier s ledger.     Coordinate with QA for rejections and take corrective actions at supplier s place to avoid recurrence. Obtain credit note for rejection/rework.     In case of any non-conformity observed during the inspection, ensure concession procedure is followed if part can be used without jeopardizing quality, safety and reliability.     In case of rework or rejection, ensure that actions should be taken within two working days.     Safe and secure movement of controlled copies of drawing. Old Drawings must be collected from suppliers after use or in case of revision.     Negotiations with suppliers and commercial aspects of purchase.     Daily monitor pending PR and Issue of purchase order for BO components.     To update HOD with Shortage list accordingly to production schedule daily.     Maintain register of rejection material received from Q.A. department.     Support in problem solving at Q table.     Develop, monitor & update skill matrix of the department.

column2: Reporting to: Sales Manager  Main Purpose of Role: To support Sales team to achieve the order booking target in terms of top line volume at targeted margin. Candidate must be knowledgeable about the export sales market and be able to convert the sales pursuits into orders. ` Main duties and responsibilities will include inter-alia : Responsible for converting enquiries to offers for the complete product range like various types of Precision Air Conditioning units, Close Control units, Data Center packages etc.. Offers should be technically and commercially correct as per company guidelines and using company authorized selection tools. To offer complete Sales Support by timely submission of Correct Techno-commercial offers. To be able to read specifications, codes, BOQ etc and make key points for configuring the units besides capturing all deviations. To be able to make compliance statements, submittals and support sales in their selling process. To be able to accompany Sales to key meetings with Consultants/ Contractors/End Customers on case to case basis. To be able to revise the selections as per changes/revisions in the enquiry. To be able to maintain records of enquiry, quotes etc and support the export sales team. To be able to demonstrate energy savings / comparison between various fans, coils, motors etc and help Sales/consultant/end customer with right choices. To be able to prioritize work and support sales without delays in submissions. To be able to interact with vendors/internal-supply chain/other factory/ costing functions so that bids can be submitted on time. To be able to identify key USPs of the product and use them as sales pitch for a given project/client etc. To be able to independently follow up on the quotes and inform the export sales team on the same. o To evolve with technological changes on a continuous basis so that knowledge matches with the industry trends and specifications. o Understanding Psychometrics would be essential. Person Specification/Profile: Must be minimum a Diploma Engineer from a reputed institution with 3-5 years experience in the same field. Should be a quick learner of Psychometrics, Fan Laws besides Air Engineering.  Must have demonstrable leadership and communication skills. o Since this is a support role -Interpersonal skills is essential. o Should be flexible in meeting deadlines and wiliness to travel if need be on short notices. Must be conversant in English, Hindi and local language and be able to effectively communicate with Sales Team, Management, Customers etc. Must have a pleasing personality and health. Candidates who are willing to learn and work over a long horizon of time only need to apply. This job description is not regarded to be totally exhaustive of all duties and activities required by the post. The post is subject to the needs of the business and will develop and change in line with prevailing market conditions, competition and development of the territory.

column2: Danfoss is looking for an Electrical Test Engineer involves the Sustenance and maintenance of automated production test equipment for testing Variable Frequency Drives    Test equipment is a critical part of the production process that ensures products are assembled and required software are loaded correctly; thus ensuring a high level of quality for the customer       Job Responsibilities        Responsibilities for this position include, but are not limited to, the following.        Sustenance of Production test equipment for Drives manufacturing       The test system and instruments must be calibrated and maintained on a regular basis       The test engineer should be familiar with the software running on the test system, as well as network connection settings.       Consults with management, engineering, and other staff regarding test capabilities, production schedules, and other considerations to facilitate production processes.       Support new product introduction as a part of a cross functional team       Independently update/modify and maintain software and hardware in test systems asper defined SOP       Interact and participate with Quality and Manufacturing Engineers during new product introductions and as part of continuous improvement initiatives.       Analyze and apply statistical methods to test data for quality improvements.       Need timely maintenance and calibrate the test equipment for all 3 value stream       Should be flexible to work on shifts and weekends, if required       Shall take improvement initiatives like Kaizen, Poke-Yoke       Ensure product and process quality using quality tools and metrics         The ideal candidate possesses these skills.         bachelors Degree in Electrical Engineering or Electronic and Communication Engineering   5-6 years experience in development and maintenance of test equipment in a production environment preferred   Experience with data acquisition, automation systems (PLCs, etc) and control panels   Experience with test software, especially National Instruments LabVIEW and TestStand   Experience with variable frequency AC drives, Regeneration and AC motors preferred   Work experience or educational background in Power Electronics preferred   Experience in new product introduction is an advantage    Proficiency in IATF core tools (FMEA, SPC, MSA, Control Plan)   Sound knowledge in Calibration of Test Equipments    Work experience in handling calibration of Measuring instruments in line with ISO/IEC 17025   Preferred candidate from EMS Industries    Knowledge in PCBA trouble shooting/ debugging will be added advantage   Ability to interact with global & internal stakeholders to consistently meet the testing KPIs

column2: About Us: Amar Equipment Pvt. Ltd.is a leading manufacturing company specializing in the production of pressure reactors. With a commitment to innovation, quality, and sustainability, we are dedicated to providing cutting-edge solutions to our clients in the chemical processing, pharmaceutical, and materials science industries.Job Description:As an experienced Purchase Engineer with a background in mechanical engineering, you will play a vital role in ensuring the seamless operation of our procurement processes. You will be responsible for sourcing high-quality materials and components while optimizing costs and maintaining strong supplier relationships.Responsibilities:Supplier Sourcing: Identify, evaluate, and select suppliers/vendors based on quality, cost, reliability, and delivery timelines. This includes sourcing laboratory equipment and chemicals in addition to mechanical components.Negotiation: Negotiate contracts, terms, and pricing agreements with suppliers to secure favourable terms and maximize value for the company, particularly in the procurement of lab equipment and chemicals.Supply Chain Management: Manage the end-to-end procurement process, including purchase order creation, tracking, and expediting to ensure timely delivery of materials, including lab equipment and chemicals.Quality Assurance: Collaborate with quality control teams to ensure that all purchased materials meet required specifications and standards, with a particular focus on the quality and safety of lab equipment and chemicals.Supplier Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with key suppliers to foster collaboration, resolve issues, and drive continuous improvement across all procurement categories, including lab equipment and chemicals.Cost Optimization: Implement cost-saving initiatives, value engineering, and alternative sourcing strategies to optimize procurement costs without compromising quality, with a specific emphasis on cost-effective procurement of lab equipment and chemicals.Market Analysis: Stay updated on industry trends, market dynamics, and supplier capabilities to identify opportunities for process improvements and innovation, including advancements in lab equipment and chemical technologies.Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.Proven experience as a Purchase Engineer or in a similar procurement role within the manufacturing industry, with a demonstrated track record of buying and dealing with lab equipment and chemicals.Strong negotiation skills with a track record of achieving cost savings and favourable terms in the procurement of lab equipment and chemicals, as well as mechanical components.Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail, particularly in the evaluation of technical specifications and safety requirements for lab equipment and chemicals.

column2: Role & responsibilities  Manage the comprehensive development of supplier base by identifying new suppliers & validating existing ones, contracts, and partnerships for the designated commodities in India, aligning them with global commodity objectives to maximize organizational outcomes.Report to department heads of both Supply chain & Production closely with to execute strategic initiatives effectively. Continuously enhance supply chain efficiency by improving supplier performance metrics such as delivery, quality, lead-time, payment terms, and inventory management, ultimately enhancing customer service and reducing total cost of ownership. Specific responsibilities include:Formulate and execute supplier strategies to fulfill manufacturing requirements and meet business goals.Maintain a thorough understanding of global industry dynamics by fostering close relationships with suppliers, trade organizations, and monitoring market trends.Contribute to the development of a comprehensive commodity strategy in coordination with internal Teams for review and endorsement by Senior Management. This entails: - Understanding business needs and objectives. - Establishing supplier strategies to address growth and risk within the supply chain. - Identifying, coordinating, and monitoring our participation in events & tradeshows - Concluding pricing negotiations and associated requirements - Negotiate and implement strategic initiatives for material sourcing and pricing strategies, including:      - Identification, evaluation, selection, and qualification of new suppliers.      - Conducting cost-benefit analyses, resolving issues, mitigating risks, and contingency planning.      - Overseeing first article evaluations.      - Manage projects to completion by coordinating technical and commercial reviews with suppliers, Quality Assurance, Engineering, and Procurement teams across the business.      - Identify and implement opportunities for cost containment and reduction, including alternate sourcing, design enhancements (in liason with management & end-customers), supplier consolidation, and Lead Time Agreements. Conduct value analyses on total logistic costs and enhance them accordingly. - Monitor and manage supplier performance:      - Track and analyze supplier performance metrics such as On-Time Delivery, devising action plans to address root causes of delays, and implementing process improvements to reduce lead times.     - Establish structured processes with suppliers to define and monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).     - Develop supplier plans/goals to drive continuous improvement in manufacturing processes, inventory management, and capacity planning, including technology development.      - Develop and benchmark best practices among suppliers.     - Develop & Maintain supplier tool/pattern database and ensure data integrity.Preferred candidate profile   - Proficiency in project management and supplier auditing. - Ability to interpret engineering drawings, understand Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing (GD&T), quality system requirements, and customer specifications. - Demonstrated ability to work with minimal supervision.Strong Microsoft Office skills, particularly in Excel, Word, Access, and PowerPoint. - Effective presentation skills and a deep understanding of processes with the ability to offer solutions. - Willingness to travel extensively. - Preference for international sourcing experience and proficiency in English; multilingualism is advantageous. - Capacity to identify areas of improvement, develop plans, and implement solutions to ensure continuous enhancement.  Education/Experience Required: - Bachelors degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Production, Metallurgical, Instrumentation, Electrical & Electronics), with expertise in Castings, Forgings (closed die / Open Die), Machining, Fabrication, Bar parts, and additional experience in rubber, Fasteners, plastic, springs, stampings. - 8 to 12 years experience in supplier development, showcasing analytical, communication, project management, and decision-making skills; operational and/or procurement experience is preferred.Perks and benefits At Par with Industry standards

column2: Facilitates the timely planning of deliveries within a supply chain and optimize inventory planning to meet service, cost and timelines objectives.       Roles Responsibilities     Inventory control    Production plan completion with minimum delay    Maintain inventory at target levels    Maintain schedule stability    Identify and resolve problems relating to inventory    Schedule usage of production materials to ensure optimal production levels    Monitor material supply flow and identify any shortages or bottlenecks in usage    Demand forecasting: Estimating future demand for products or services based on historical data, market trends, and other relevant factors. Accurate demand forecasting helps in determining production levels and schedules.    Capacity planning: Assessing the production capacity of facilities, equipment, and labour to ensure that they align with the anticipated demand. It involves analysing current capacity, identifying bottlenecks, and making decisions regarding capacity expansion or contraction.    Production scheduling: Creating detailed plans and schedules for production activities, including the allocation of resources, and determining the sequence of operations. Scheduling considers factors such as product requirements, availability of resources, and delivery deadlines.    Material planning: Determining the quantity and timing of raw materials, components, and other inputs required for production. This involves maintaining an appropriate inventory level to avoid stockouts or excessive inventory holding costs.    Shop floor control: Monitoring and controlling production activities on the shop floor to ensure that they adhere to the planned schedules and quality standards. It involves tracking work progress, addressing deviations or delays, and resolving any issues that may arise during production.    Quality control: Implementing measures to maintain and improve product quality throughout the production process. This includes quality inspections, testing, and implementing corrective actidons to address any quality issues.    Performance measurement: Collecting and analyzing production data to evaluate the performance of the production system, identify areas for improvement, and make informed decisions for future planning.
column13: Supply chain, Product quality, Usage, Demand forecasting, Inventory control, Labour, Manager Quality Control, Shop floor control, Inventory, Capacity planning

Identify and investigate discrepancies, resolve outstanding items, and maintain accurate cash balances.   Accounts Payable: Process vendor invoices, prepare payment vouchers, and reconcile vendor statements. Review payment terms, discounts, and payment schedules to optimize cash flow and minimize late payments.   Accounts Receivable: Generate customer invoices, track receivables, and follow up on overdue payments. Monitor aging reports, communicate with customers regarding payment status, and initiate collection efforts as necessary.   Financial Reporting: Assist in the preparation of financial statements, reports, and schedules for internal and external stakeholders. Compile financial data, reconcile accounts, and support month-end and year-end closing processes.

column2: We are currently looking for a Mechanical Engineer to work on developing products using core mechanical engineering skills.      The future is what we make it. When you join Honeywe'll, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, futurists, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywe'll isn't just about developing cool things. That s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.           ?    JOB EXPECTATION    :      Work in a global team as an Individual Contributor with responsibilities and ownership for mechanical design in Value Engineering (VE) and Component Engineering (CE).    The responsibilities include identifying cost reduction ideas from part & process design by BOM analysis, ownership on VE/CE projects.    Responsible for VE ideation, Conceptualization, designs & product implementation.   Fundamental knowledge of mechanical Engineering, Experience in GD&T, tolerance stack-up analysis. Good knowledge in Drafting Standards especially ASME 14.5M   The candidate will be working along with various teams such as design, simulation, drafting, evaluation, manufacturing, marketing, supply chain etc    Additional responsibilities include technical report generation, documentation, and progress reporting.    It is also expected that the candidate would develop technical expertise in the product lines quickly to develop VE/CE ideas.   Candidate is expected to have good knowledge in Electro - mechanical design with the ability to use this knowledge on VE/CE ideation in Electro - mechanical design for Industrial Material Handling Equipment & Systems.   Fundamental knowledge of Electrical Engineering and understanding of the electrical parts, is an added advantage.   Having a proven record of design delivery in a New Product Introduction (NPI) team for at least 6 10 yrs will be a plus.   Ability to work independently with minimum guidance from Senior Design engineers in the team. Global working experience will be an added advantage.        YOU MUST HAVE:                 ?   B. E/ B.Tech or M.E/ M. Tech in Mechanical Engineering   6 - 10 years of experience in design and development of Mechanical products.        ?    We Value:      Experience in Value engineering and component engineering. Knowledge on Value engineering methodologies.    Good Knowledge & Hand on experience in Mechanical part & system design    Have good understanding on different manufacturing processes like plastic injection molding, metal parts machining, casting, sheet metal process, joining methodologies (crimping, welding, brazing, soldering) methodologies.    Good knowledge on Material selection such as engineering plastics, metals, sheet metal & plating for part design.     Good knowledge & understanding of manufacturing process like Machining, Casting, Sheet metal process, Plastic Injection Molding, joining methodologies.     Working knowledge on DFA, DFM & DFT     Basic knowledge on stress/strain analysis & mechanical simulation using FEA tool like Ansys is preferred    .       Good knowledge about materials such as engineering plastics, metals, plating.   Knowledge of should costing.   Capable in using CAD package Solid Works.    Exposure to Six Sigma methodology and statistical analysis.     Working knowledge in Drafting Standards especially ASME 14.5M    .      Experience on GD&T and Statistical Tolerance Analysis, Design for Manufacturability and Assembly     Experience in developing DFMEA, PFMEA, control plan and process flow chart.   Exposure to handling engineering change request and engineering change order.   Conceptualize the product and translate the requirements into CTQs for design.   Exposure to full design life cycle in New product development.   Hands on experience on PDM/PLM tools like SAP/Oracle/Team Centre etc   Knowledge on Material handling equipment design would be added advantage.   Problem solving Skills: Independently leads problem analysis to develop new processes and procedures.   Demonstrates accountability (collaborating with others) for the design / implementation/ delivery of subsystem/product.   Writes a project final report/ project team presentation or demonstration to a divisional customer or management.   Good Business Communication skills: Interacts with Partners at global locations, local team members & management stake holders and customers for requirements capturing.   Works with all the stakeholders to ensure that technical objectives are met with the given project/program constraints. Active participation in the project planning/execution phases for technical risk management. Understanding of product certification requirements
