column2: The Dispatch Manager leads Warehouse & logistics department at unit that includes dispatch executives and a team of FG loading & forklift operators    She or he is responsible for people and team development, motivating the team and ensuring quality performance    Responsibilities include meeting business requirement with timely dispatch, coordinating with Planning, sales & plant production team to ensure optimum availability of FG to cater the requirement    This position must closely work with excise department & transporters to ensure execution of the excise permits within stipulated time    This role will also include obtaining all approvals / permissions from excise to operate the plant along with coaching team members to utilize the processes and facilitate problem-solving on the floor                 Role and Responsibilities                   Driving dispatch team for achieving individual, team and business unit goals & and maintain a strong team culture            Develop and maintain detailed written facility policies, standards and procedures (SOP) for the warehouse & Inventory Norms. column2: The Ingersoll Rand Commodity Manager manages Regional /Global Commodity Strategy, Commodity Market intelligence & materials procurement process through working with vendor team leads to sustain delivery of products, assembly processes, and services to meet business requirements. Driving cost and time effective delivery of quality components through key vendor relationships is critical. This position is responsible for the timely planning and securing of supplies to meet business requirements. The role is key to leading the Company forward in securing quality suppliers of materials and components covering price, delivery and quality targets        Responsibilities:                Lead category /commodity segment under India region and drive Category management actions for the region.                  Consistently and effectively source materials to meet demand plans;                 Demonstrate procurement work performance through criteria related to quality, availability, and cost of materials necessary to meet business requirements;                 Negotiation, and support of vendor contracts, service level agreements, and performance measurement programs related to materials/assembly acquisition;                 Develop business relationships with suppliers that enable long term optimized support of company requirements to reduce cost and improve service;                 Identify and drive proactive cost reduction opportunities                 Provide direct input and utilization of respective data in ERP system, to drive the appropriate system knowledge, procurement work performance results, and meet planning demands of the business;                 Continuously seek opportunities to improve methodologies and their application to assigned business processes while maintaining the long-term sustainability of these processes.                 Provide detailed data, information, and reports related to plans / results of procurement activities                 Work with Accounts Payable and Receiving to resolve any invoicing and receiving issues                    Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:                    Extensive global sourcing experience & strong negotiation skills                 Contracting, pricing, supply chain/sourcing strategies                 Must possess demonstrated work experience to work with outsourced manufacturing suppliers and procurement teams to drive problem resolution, VMI / SOMI implementation, quality processes, and effective source cost analysis                   Review long lead time and unique components to ensure product availability                 Demonstrated success in supplier management, cost reduction & inventory management                 Must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, with associated procurement based technical knowledge                   Strong personal computer application usage skills are required (Desktop office and ERP systems applications)                 Must be able to work in an environment of short notice changes, and tolerate interruptions                 Direct experience with Oracle/ SAP ERP Business Systems and related procurement transactions desired                 CPIM, and/or other certifications a plus                 Testing Knowledge - Chemical & mechanical properties, structure analysis,                    Min. Yrs. Experience: `15+ years  Education Standard: Technical Degree  Education Type: BE in Mechanical- Casting     & Machining     (Ferrous & Al casting)                  Key Competencies:                To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.                 Supply Chain Acumen       - Understands the key value creation processes within the Procurement function and the role of category manager plays.              Project Management      - Identifies resource needs, develops project plan, and drives project execution.              Business Thinking/Strategizing      -Demonstrates regional knowledge of suppliers, industry trends and new process/technology.              Problem Solving       -   Understands and can execute the three root cause approach to problem solving - demonstrated ability to lead corrective action plan implementation and validation.              Relationship Management       - Works collaboratively with cross-functional stakeholders at all levels.

column2: Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE) develops the cloud service capabilities that support Danfoss and its customers    The CCoE enables our global digital transformation, and requirements while progressing on our multi-cloud adoption journey   For CCoE we are looking for an experienced Product Owner who is passionate about maximizing the value of our cloud services by engaging and building strong collaboration with our stakeholders while representing the business requirements and empowering the organization to utilize cloud as a trusted accelerator for digital growth   You will join a dedicated team with highly skilled cloud architects and engineers that handle infrastructure at a global scale within Danfoss     This is a new position where you will play a key role in the global cloud journey   You will be working in a global cross-functional environment with close contact to many different stakeholders like; Manufacturing Technology Teams, Software Developers, and other relevant stakeholders from the business segments and Global IT       Job Responsibilities       Lead on cloud vision, purpose, and product roadmap in alignment with business objectives and technology capabilities          Communicate and analyze business requirements and current challenges based on close dialogue with our customers          Keep up with new and emerging cloud technologies, trends that drive innovation and continuous improvement of the cloud products          Maintain the backlog while prioritizing based on value, risk, and dependencies to ensure a clear execution plan knowledge sharing, and best practices among stakeholders, users, and partners          Stakeholder management and communication to the cloud community          Acting as an evangelist for the CCoE s cloud products within the organization to maximize value       Background & Skills         To be a great Product Owner at Danfoss you will need to have strong analytical and problem-solving skills that build on a customer focused mindset    You will further need to provide a high degree of cross-cultural collaboration, organizational and stakeholder relationship building skills, together with a technical understanding and curiosity in creating reliable, future-proof cloud solutions   It will be your role to be the face of our product within the organization and will have to take responsibility for developing cloud product roadmaps, stakeholder management for the cloud environment, clear and prioritized backlogs while engaging with and enabling your team members         The ideal candidate possesses these skills:         5+ years of experience working as a Product Owner, Product Manager in an international organization, or similar role within cloud solutions skills with a customer centric mindset          Passionate about making useful cloud products available to the organization          Familiar with working in an agile environment          Experience column2: You are a detail oriented, self-directed person that enjoys creating infrastructure-as-code. You are excited about the prospect of working across a broad array of DevOps concerns, including automating deployment and scaling of ML pipelines for our AI and web dashboards, helping lead our teams containerization and automated deployment efforts, and building out advanced metrics monitoring infrastructure. Maybe you ve worked on big projects before/for a big company, or perhaps many small consulting projects where standard infrastructure was needed, or maybe even a startup where you were turning ideas into working software platforms. You are ready for a fresh challenge - to be the person that defines what devops and deployment looks like at a fast-growing, AI- and robotics-centric company. You love test-driving new technologies, and you like the challenge of incorporating them into your organization in a secure, sustainable way.  What You ll Need    BS in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent technical experience.   10+ years of internet technology work experience, as a programmer or infrastructure-as-code developer.   Experience deploying containerized services in production.   Comfortable with cloud technologies, e.g., cloud VMs, databases, blob storage, serverless functions   Interest and experience designing secure, maintainable cloud deployment pipelines.   Strong familiarity with the GitHub ecosystem and modern CI/CD practices.   Knowledge of and comfort with cloud compute technologies, including network, data integrity (backup), and security considerations.   Customer obsession! We are a customer-obsessed company. If you are not already customer-obsessed, expect to become so!   Nice to Have    2+ years experience working with production infrastructure-as-code technologies (e.g. AWS CDK, Terraform, Pulumi, etc.)   Deep knowledge and experience in at least one of the major cloud compute platforms (AWS, Azure, and/or Google Cloud) - note that we are currently multi-provider (AWS, Azure.)   Experience in distributed ML inference with platforms such as AWS Sagemaker, GCP Vertex, Seldon, or Kubeflow.   Interest and experience in building complete code-to-production pipelines.   Specific experience building/maintaining metrics and logging systems.   Familiarity with flexible, cloud based CI/CD tooling, such as GitHub actions.   Familiarity with clustering tools such as Kubernetes.   Expertise in ML is not required, but familiarity with ML architectures and lifecycle, especially in computer vision with deep learning is a plus.   What You ll Do   As a DevOps Engineer working with our ML and Web teams, you will:    Identify and implement containerization, networking, and security best practices for our web and ML back-end applications.   Help us scale up our ML pipeline packaging by improving how we distribute the inference workload to multiple nodes.    Ensure the reliability and observability of our pipelines by introducing monitoring, metrics, and logging tools.   Increase our development velocity by leveraging containerization, infrastructure-as-code, and modern CI/CD practices.   Create tools, automation scripts and processes to manage our ML models and our datasets.   Compensation and Benefits    Competitive salary   Comprehensive health insurance   Very flexible schedule   Customized PTO
column13: Supply chain, Computer science, DVR, Computer vision, Automation, Consulting, Machine learning, Packaging, VMS, Monitoring

column2: Role & responsibilities  Plan, organize and order parts (materials) to Italy, China from suppliers against customer requirement & stock availability and handle the spares warehouse. Ensure and follow-up with the suppliers for the received parts and raise the purchase order on a timely basis. Ensure that the parts shipment arrives within the given time. Plan and organize for shipment delivery immediately with the forwarder and check the materials as per the purchase order upon receiving the same. Ensure allocation of materials into the location in a proper & a safe way. Ensure to inform the material details and provide necessary documents to accounts team to raise the invoice and other necessary documents. Confirm the availability of the delivery service with the courier team and allocate shipments with invoice and other documents intact. Ensure and provide the dispatch information to customers and the concerned team with invoices, photos, and courier details, following up with the courier team for timely delivery of the shipment.Ensure stock audit and maintain stock as per min-max, order parts to BIN and prepare the GRN for the same. Provide necessary support to the customers immediately on any document or materials and collect back the defective parts from customers and allocate to the scrap location.Check and return the defective parts to the quality team for analysis, scrap the materials with approvals and provide necessary support to the spares team to complete the task in an efficient manner. Ensure to close the service ticket within the timeline. Ensure and maintain proper housekeeping, 6s in spares warehouse and focus on cost reduction and recycling of waste effectively. column2: We are seeking an experienced Expediting Specialist to join our manufacturing team. The Expediting Specialist will play a crucial role in ensuring the timely and efficient flow of materials, components, and products throughout the production process. The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of experience in expediting within the manufacturing industry, demonstrating a strong understanding of supply chain management and production processes.       Responsibilities:       Monitor Production Schedule: Collaborate with production planners and project managers to understand production schedules, priorities, and deadlines. Regularly review the production plan to identify potential bottlenecks and proactively address them. Material Coordination: Coordinate with procurement and logistics teams to ensure timely delivery of raw materials, components, and supplies required for production. Communicate with suppliers to track shipments, expedite deliveries, and resolve any delivery-related issues or delays.        Expedite Orders: Take proactive measures to expedite orders and streamline the production process. Identify critical orders or high-priority items and prioritize their processing to meet customer delivery deadlines. Communication and Coordination: Maintain effective communication with internal stakeholders, including production teams, quality control, engineering, and shipping departments. Ensure that all relevant parties are informed about production status, delays, and changes in priorities. Problem Resolution: Identify potential delays or production disruptions and take appropriate actions to address them.        Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve issues related to materials, equipment, or any other factors impacting production schedules. Performance Tracking: Monitor and track the progress of production orders to ensure they are moving according to plan. Identify any deviations or delays and take corrective actions to bring the production back on track.        Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of production orders, material flow, and expediting activities. Generate regular reports highlighting production progress, delays, and actions taken to mitigate risks or improve efficiency. Continuous Improvement: Identify areas for process improvement within the expediting function. Propose and implement strategies to optimize material flow, reduce lead ti     mes, and enhance overall efficiency.       Requirements:        Minimum of 5 years of experience in expediting within the manufacturing industry.       In-depth knowledge of supply chain management, production processes, and materials management.       Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.       Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with internal teams and external suppliers.       Problem-solving and decision-making abilities to address production issues and overcome obstacles.       Proficient in using computer software and systems related to production planning, materials management, and reporting.       Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and quality.       Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.       Bachelors degree in a relevant field is preferred, but not mandatory.        Additional Job Description       Additional Job Description        Designs, models, and tests prototypes for products.       Identifies and selects materials needed for production.       Improves usability of an item.       Lists costs involved in productions.       Ensures that production methods are efficient, cost-effective, and meet organizational goals.       Develops procedures for ensuring quality and reliability.       Other duties as assigned
